utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m glad to see you made it safely. How’s your hotel?

utterance.speaker: Amy (on Skype)
utterance.content: It’s not the best Best Western I’ve been to, but I’d say it’s the third best Best Western I’ve been to.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I know how you feel. The Best Buy by my house is only the third best Best Buy. They have the best buys, but having the best buys isn’t the only thing that makes a Best Buy the best Best Buy.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What makes a best Best Buy the best Best Buy?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Mm, that’s a great question. I like when they’re next to a Chipotle.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay, well, I should unpack.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right. Enjoy the neurobiology conference.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I will. I wish you were here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: At a neurobiology conference? What a mean thing to say.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay, I’m glad you’re not here?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Aw, you always know just what to say after I tell you what to say.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Good-bye, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Bye. Oh, good news, gentlemen. Amy’s at a conference this weekend, which means I’m available to be entertained, hmm. As today’s youth might put it, who wants to get their Sheld-on?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Bernie and I are getting the house ready for the remodel. We could always use an extra pair of hands.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That sounds awful. Raj?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, I’ve got time booked in the telescope room all weekend scanning for rogue planets. You’re more than welcome to join me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s the one to beat. Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, if anything, I’m trying to get my Sheld-off.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, then it looks like we have a winner. Congratulations.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, I should warn you, it’s just looking at data for hours and hours on a computer screen.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh, stop selling it, kid. You won.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How was your day?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, not good. Still couldn’t get in to see Dr. Gallo.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A doctor? Well, I hope you’re not contagious. I’ve got a weekend in the telescope room I’ve been excited about for almost three minutes.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m not sick. It’s for work. There’s this doctor who refuses to see any sales reps. I’ve been trying to get in for months.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, did you try wearing the shirt I said was inappropriate for work?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, the doctor’s a woman, but yes, because you never know.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What kind of doctor is she?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, a psychiatrist. Why?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, what if you make an appointment as a patient? Then you’ll get to talk to her.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, they already know I’m a pharmaceutical sales rep.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh. What if Leonard made an appointment and tried to lay some groundwork for you?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s interesting.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m not gonna make a fake appointment with a psychiatrist. What would I say is wrong with me?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Low self-esteem.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Social anxiety.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sexual insecurity.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: None of that is true.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, denial. See, sweetie, the list goes on and on.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s just crazy. How would my going in there even help you?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t know. You could talk to her, and maybe if it comes up, you could ask if she’s heard about the drug.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What if I get caught?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Fear of failure.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Lack of confidence.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Kind of a wuss.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fine, I’ll do it. But not because of them, because I love you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Pushover.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Spineless.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Still hasn’t bought milk even though I told him two days ago.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That was incredible.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It was. I just wish Stuart wasn’t around so we didn’t have to be so quiet.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I know. It’s not like he returns the favour when he watches his Japanese porn cartoons.

utterance.speaker: Stuart (knocking)
utterance.content: You guys got a minute, or are you still cuddling?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What is it, Stuart?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Can I come in?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hang on. Should I send him away?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No, it’s okay.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Thanks, Bernie.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Uh, well, I know the remodel is coming up, so I thought I’d make it easy on you guys and find my own place.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wow. I thought I was done getting lucky tonight.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So, when are you thinking of moving?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Uh, actually, I already found an apartment, so in a couple of days.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh. Okay. Sorry to see you go?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Okay, well, thank you guys for everything. I, I really appreciate it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: : You’re very welcome.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Hmm, I just have never been in this room while you’re awake.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, making sure the telescope’s camera is white-field balanced.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hmm. What are you doing now?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Still making sure the telescope’s camera is white-field balanced.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I see. How about now?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Now I’m making sure the telescope’s camera is white-field balanced and wishing you had a colouring book.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I can be helpful. Give me something to do. You know, my father took me to work once, and in ten minutes I figured out who’d been stealing from the cash register. It was my father. Yeah, Dad lost his job, but Mr. Hinckley gave me a Fudgsicle.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Fine, you want something to do? There’s about six months of data on this hard drive. Why don’t you go through it and see if you can spot any patterns or anomalies.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yep, I’m on it. Hey, look at that, an Indian guy outsourcing a computer job to a white fella.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, okay, whatever it takes to keep you busy for a few hours.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Found one.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, you didn’t. There are millions of data points there.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But, look, an optical transient.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, maybe that is something. How did you find that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It wasn’t difficult. You know how when you see prime numbers, they appear red, but when they’re twin primes, they’re pink and smell like gasoline?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. I guess I’m a special boy. You know, sometimes when a boy is special, he gets a Fudgsicle. Which, by the way, tastes like the speed of light.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you for seeing me on such short notice.

utterance.speaker: Dr Gallo
utterance.content: Ah, it’s my pleasure. I’m curious, are you related to Dr. Beverly Hofstadter?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, she’s my mother. You know her?

utterance.speaker: Dr Gallo
utterance.content: No, not personally, but I have read all of her books.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, then you know her better than I do.

utterance.speaker: Dr Gallo
utterance.content: Well, I’m not so sure about that. But I can tell you I do not agree with her theories on child rearing at all.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really? Any chance you find them cold, cruel and unsuitable for innocent little boys who just want to be happy?

utterance.speaker: Dr Gallo
utterance.content: Well, I didn’t want to say it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, no, say it. Sing it. Rent a plane, write it in the sky.

utterance.speaker: Dr Gallo
utterance.content: Sounds like you’re holding on to quite a bit of anger towards her.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, no, I, I’ve worked through a lot of that stuff, I’m better now.

utterance.speaker: Dr Gallo
utterance.content: Mm. Good for you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Do you know she never let me celebrate my birthday because being born was her achievement, not mine?

utterance.speaker: Dr Gallo
utterance.content: That’s heartbreaking.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Right? To this day, I send her a card every year with a little money in it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know, once we get the house back to ourselves, we can be romantic in any room we want.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Great. I can finally show you where the laundry room is.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Boy, who would’ve thought when you asked me to move in and help take care of your mom, I’d still be here two years later?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No one.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Nobody thought that.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Well, that’s it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I guess so.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: This is weird.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah. A grown man moving into his own apartment. Crazy times. See ya.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Ignore him. He’s just using humour to express how happy he is.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: It’s okay. I know he loves me.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Sure he does. Well, let us know when you’re all settled in.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I will. And I really can’t thank you guys enough.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Our pleasure.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Goodbye.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He’s gone. Let’s start in the garage.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, so once we receive the next image and compare it to the ones we’ve already collected, we’ll know what it is that we found.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ooh, perhaps it’s a Heliosheath scintillation.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It could be a trans-Neptunian object.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Maybe it’s a new planet.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Unlikely, but it could be a dwarf planet.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, as long as it has a healthy gravity and all its moons, I’ll be happy.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, the final image is coming in. And the object we discovered is…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Come on, Daddy needs a livable planet he can rule with an iron fist.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: A medium-sized asteroid.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s it? How common. That’s the chicken fingers on the menu of space.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I kind of like chicken fingers.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, me, too. I was stuck for a metaphor.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Come on, a medium-sized asteroid is still an interesting discovery.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I suppose it could end up on a collision course with Earth and destroy life as we know it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You dream different than me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It is kind of cute.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, it is. And you know we get to name it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We better choose a name no one can make fun of. Sir Frederick William Herschel didn’t do Uranus any favours.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, how’d it go?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, great. Dr. Gallo is terrific. You know, I, I’ve always been insecure that no one cares about what I have to say, but she made me see…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, no one cares. Did you help me out or not?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, now, what I’m hearing is that you feel that I sometimes take too long to express myself, and you wish I’d be more succinct.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re only hearing that because I cannot roll my eyes any louder.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right, well, after we talked about my issues with my mother, nothing too deep, just how she ruined my life, I told her about you and your drug. She said she’d be happy to meet you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really? Oh, you’re the best husband ever.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So you’ll go to the Doctor Who convention with me next week?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I guess.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, I actually did hear your eyes roll that time.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Boy, when was the last time Stuart cleaned this place?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No kidding. Oh, okay, I’m about to suck something up. What do you think this object sounds like?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howie, I don’t want to play Lego, Toenail or Pill anymore. So, what do you think we should do with this room?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, I was thinking a home theatre or a gaming room, you know, like a man cave.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Why can’t it be a woman cave?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: As long as it has a home theatre, a video game system and you’re not allowed in it, you can call it whatever you want.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m being serious.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, what do you think we should do?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I don’t know, maybe a home office or, oh look. The teddy bear Stuart won the night we took him to the fair.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh. He was so excited.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah. You know, no matter how hard they tried, they could not guess his age.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’ll give it to him next time I see him.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Have you heard from him since he left?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No. You’d think he would’ve called once he got settled in.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hmm. Maybe he’s busy.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Too busy to call? He wasn’t too busy to binge-watch Hot in Cleveland with my Hulu password. What is happening? Are we missing him?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No, that’s not what this feeling is. Is it?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Of course not. He drove us crazy. Like when you were gonna make that pie and Stuart ate all the blueberries.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: And he tried to deny it, but his teeth were all purple.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That was pretty cute.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah. Ew, we are missing him!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So I was thinking, maybe we can come up with a name for the asteroid by combining our names.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s a great idea. I’ve got it. We’ll call it Cooper.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: How is that both our names?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Koo from Koothrappali and per from Cooper.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, s-so it’s, like, Kooper with a K?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Nah, you’re right, that’s dumb.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, Leonard, great news. We discovered a medium-sized asteroid together.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wow, that’s amazing. I’m in a pretty great mood today myself.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay. Guess we’re gonna talk about you now.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, we are, because Dr. Gallo made me realize that I’m a worthwhile person and that my feelings matter.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I learned that for free from a cat poster, but good for you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, back to me. I discovered an asteroid, and now I get to name it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wait, what happened to us?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Now, this isn’t about us, this is about what’s best for the asteroid.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, what are you thinking of naming it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I haven’t settled on anything yet.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We haven’t settled on anything yet.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, way to go, Cat Poster. You hang in there.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know what’d be nice? Name it after your girlfriends. Show them how much you care.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That is a great idea.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s perfect. It appears romantic, but it’s really just a rock in space that gets me out of Valentine’s Day forever.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So, uh, what were you thinking? Combine their names?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I like it. Yeah, we’ll take the A-M from Amy and, uh, the Y from Emily.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’s just Amy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Exactly. See how well we work together?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And in double-blind studies, Placinex proved extremely effective in treating all kinds of anxiety. Actually, funny story, the boys in the lab were worried about getting FDA approval for Placinex. They started taking it, stopped worrying.

utterance.speaker: Dr Gallo
utterance.content: Got it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, do you have any questions?

utterance.speaker: Dr Gallo
utterance.content: Just one.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mm-hmm?

utterance.speaker: Dr Gallo
utterance.content: When you made your husband pretend to be a patient so you could get access to me, what were you thinking there?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I just meant a question about the drug.

utterance.speaker: Dr Gallo
utterance.content: Yeah, I know what you meant. Let’s put that aside for a minute and talk about why you married Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t wanna.

utterance.speaker: Dr Gallo
utterance.content: Here is a man raised by an overbearing woman who completely dominated every aspect of his formative years. Do you think he’s perpetuating that relationship by seeking out a partner like you?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, I used to wear tank tops a lot. That was a big selling point.

utterance.speaker: Amy (on Skype)
utterance.content: Hi, Sheldon. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good news. You’re an asteroid.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Uh, please tell me what to say next.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Perhaps I should explain. While working with Koothrappali, we discovered an asteroid, and I named it after you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh. Sheldon, thank you. That’s so romantic. But what about Rajesh? He was okay with you choosing the name?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, it took a little negotiating, but I wore him down. Uh, we get the asteroid, and if you and I have children, they all have to be named Rajesh.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: All of them?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Even the girls.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay, I think I know what to say now.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How can I not sound like his mother when our entire bedroom is filled with Star Wars toys? I mean, have you ever had sex with a stuffed Wookiee watching you?

utterance.speaker: Dr Gallo
utterance.content: I went to college in the ’70s. It was a hairier time. I’m gonna say yes.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, if anything, he’s turning me into his mother. Before I did pharmaceutical sales, I was an actress. You know, I was pretty good. You know, girl-next-door type, but hot. Doable.

utterance.speaker: Dr Gallo
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And not only am I Leonard’s mother, but we have this man-child living with us named Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Dr Gallo
utterance.content: Oh, Leonard talked a lot about him. I wasn’t sure if he was real.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, he’s as real as the fine I get when I use too much toilet paper.

utterance.speaker: Dr Gallo
utterance.content: Wow, you really do have a lot on your plate.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I do. You know, Leonard’s right. Talking to you is really helping.

utterance.speaker: Dr Gallo
utterance.content: Oh, I’m glad. You know, you might also benefit from a prescription for anxiety.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, if you think it’ll help. Oh, just don’t make it Placinex. I do not need sudden fits of homicidal rage.

utterance.speaker: Amy (on Skype)
utterance.content: I miss you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I miss you as well.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I can’t believe I miss Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I guess I just miss when life was simpler.

utterance.speaker: Girls
utterance.content: Go, Leonard! Go, Leonard! Go, Leonard! Go, Leonard!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Remember, girls, you decide what makes you happy, not your emotionally withholding mothers.

utterance.speaker: Girls
utterance.content: Go, Leonard! Go, Leonard! Go, Leonard! Go, Leonard! Go, Leonard!

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I really miss this.
